vectorData.altText: 4. What is the name of region B?
That's right!  The region of an organ that contains its vessels, nerves, lymphatics and, in this case, airways, is referred to as its hilum.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
REMOVE both lungs from the cadaver,

The roots of the lungs consist of the airways, blood vessels, lymphatics and nerves that service the organ, surrounded by connective tissue. The root of the lung attaches it to the structures of the mediastinum.

one at a time. Start by isolating the root of the lung with your hands. Gently pull the lung laterally, away from the mediastinum to create more room in which to work, and to ensure that you cut through the root of the lung and not the lung itself.

Cut through the structures comprising the root of the lung using large, blunt scissors.
Ease each lung out of the pleural cavity. If it doesn’t come easily, check that you’ve cut through all of the structures in the root of the lung.
You will next examine the lungs, and then the pleural cavities.
